to be appreciated for what it is, not for its underlying meaning, for good literature must" invite attention, interest, and pleasure for itself alone and not for secondary considerations as its truth or philosophy. <q> strong emphasis is placed on the sanctity of experience in any given moment in lewis' space trilogy; in out of the silent planet, ransom finds that the hrossa do not understand the need to hear a poem more than once, nor the need to continuously enjoy the same pleasure: <NO_QUOTATION>[ hyoi] continued, </q> the poem is a good example. for the most splendid line becomes fully splendid only by means of all the lines after it; if you went back to it you would find it less splendid than you thought
